metadata.title: CVE-2021-47181 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usb:musb: tusb6010: check return value after calling platform_get_resource() Itwill cause null-ptr-deref if platform_get_resource() returns NULL, we needcheck the return value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47181` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-lowlatency - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-aws - 4.4.0-1136.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-azure - 4.15.0-1130.143~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.142').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1130.143~14.04.1').
